title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: The Something in the Way festival at Roadrunner features two dozen indie bands in a two-day event.
Photographer Ben Stas captured highlights of performances by The Hotelier, February, and Tigers Jaw.
Artists like Teen Suicide and Angel Du$t performed at the festival, offering a range of emo to screamo music.

title: Patriots fullback Jack Westover says his sister bet Super Bowl LX matchup in training camp
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Jack Westover's sister bet $5 on a Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX matchup during training camp.
Her prediction proved accurate, resulting in an $18,000 payout for the unlikely championship matchup.
Westover, a native of Washington, transitioned from tight end to fullback and joined the Patriots' practice squad in 2024.

title: Watch: Mike Vrabel and Drake Maye address crowd at Patriots’ send-off rally
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Drake Maye and Mike Vrabel addressed the crowd at the Patriots’ send-off rally in Foxborough on Sunday.
Maye, who missed practice due to illness and injury, expressed gratitude to fans and received MVP chants.
The Patriots will face the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium on February 8 at 6:30 p.m.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Alexander Skarsgård hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Alexander Skarsgård hosted the 1,000th episode of 'Saturday Night Live' on Jan. 31, with Cardi B as the musical guest.
Former 'SNL' star Pete Davidson made a cameo in the political cold open as White House border czar Tom Homan.
Alexander Skarsgård's father, Stellan Skarsgård, appeared in the episode following his recent Oscar nomination.

title: Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald grew up in Scituate and dreamed of running the Red Sox
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Seahawks coach Mike Macdonald, from Scituate, Massachusetts, grew up as a dedicated Boston sports fan.
Macdonald dreamed of being Red Sox general manager and cited a strong love for baseball.
He became Seattle's head coach in 2024, achieving a 24-10 regular-season record and reaching Super Bowl LX.

title: Watch: Patriots’ Super Bowl LX send-off rally
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The Patriots held a Super Bowl send-off rally at Gillette Stadium featuring Robert Kraft, Mike Vrabel, and team captains.
The team departs from T.F. Green Airport to California for Super Bowl LX against the Seattle Seahawks on Feb. 8.
DraftKings and FanDuel list the Patriots as 4.5-point underdogs to the Seahawks for this year's Super Bowl.

title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Cornerback Carlton Davis encourages free agents to consider joining the New England Patriots this offseason citing their positive culture.
The Patriots have substantial projected salary cap space and attracted key players like Stefon Diggs and Milton Williams last offseason.
Potential 2026 free agents include George Pickens, Trey Hendrickson, and Jaelan Phillips, who could further strengthen the Patriots roster.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams ranks eighth among the Patriots' top 10 free-agent signings, excelling in his first season with the team.
Williams signed a four-year, $104 million contract, contributing 5.5 sacks and nine pressures in the postseason.
Mike Vrabel tops the list as the best Patriots free-agent signing, thanks to his impact and versatility.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Celtics are unlikely to make big trades before the deadline, focusing on smaller roster additions.
Potential targets for the Celtics include Nets center Nic Claxton and Mavericks center Daniel Gafford.
Celtics interested in acquiring players like Keon Ellis, Yyves Missi, and Day'Ron Sharpe for strategic improvements.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Something in the Way Fest 2026 takes place Jan. 31 and Feb. 1 at Boston's Roadrunner venue.
Explosions in the Sky closed the festival with a 90-minute instrumental set featuring atmospheric lighting and emotional odysseys.
The Hotelier, a Worcester-based indie emo band, opened with energetic performances, highlighting the band's strong New England following.
